description: The INFERTILITY_CYCLE table contains information about fertility treatment cycles.

columns.name: CYCLE_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier for the fertility treatment cycle record.

columns.name: CYCLE_NAME
columns.description: The fertility treatment cycle name.

columns.name: RECORD_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The record status (hidden, soft-deleted, etc.)


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Soft Deleted


Hidden


Hidden and Soft Deleted

columns.name: TREATMENT_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The fertility treatment cycle planned treatment of assisted reproductive technology (ART) or non-ART. ART treatments are those where oocytes are removed from the body and/or later returned as part of the attempt to get pregnant.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Assisted Reproductive Technologies


Non-Assisted Reproductive Technologies

columns.name: TREATMENT_START_DATE
columns.description: The start date of the fertility treatment cycle is when the medication to stimulate follicular development is given, the first day of natural menses for unstimulated cycles, or when a patient receives steroids to prepare the endometrium for frozen cycles.

columns.name: CYCLE_OUTCOME_C_NAME
columns.description:
The outcome of the fertility treatment cycle.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Pregnancy


No Pregnancy


No Transfer


Canceled


Completed


Cycle Created in Error

columns.name: CYCLE_RESOLUTION_DATE
columns.description: The outcome date of the fertility treatment cycle.

columns.name: CYCLE_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The status of the fertility treatment cycle.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Active


Finished


Deleted

columns.name: RECORD_CREATION_DT
columns.description: The date the record was created.

columns.name: CREATED_DEPARTMENT_ID
columns.description: Stores the login department of the user where the fertility cycle was created.

columns.name: CANCEL_REASON_C_NAME
columns.description:
The reason the fertility treatment was canceled.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Low Response


High Response


Inadequate Endometrial Response


Concurrent Illness


Psychological


Financial


Family Emergency


Other

columns.name: CANCEL_REASON_CMT
columns.description: Comment for the cycle cancellation reason.

columns.name: COMPLICATIONS_CMT
columns.description: Comment for the cycle complications field.

columns.name: EGGS_RETRIEVED_NUM
columns.description: The number of eggs retrieved on the fertility cycle.

columns.name: EGG_RETRIEVAL_DATE
columns.description: The date the eggs were retrieved.

columns.name: EMBRYO_NO_TRANSFER_RSN_C_NAME
columns.description:
Reason for why an embryo wasn't transferred for the fertility treatment cycle.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Inability to Obtain Sperm


Risk of Hyperstimulation


Preimplantation Genetic Testing


No Normal Oocytes/Embryos (after PGT results) Available for Future Use


No Normal Oocytes/Embryos (did not utilize PGT) Available for Future Use


Endometrial Receptivity Concerns


Failure to Survive Thaw


Planned Multiple Cycles (Egg/Embryo accumulation) with PGT


Planned Multiple Cycles (Egg/Embryo accumulation) without PGT


Low Ovarian Response


High Ovarian Response


Inadequate Endometrial Response


Concurrent Illness


Withdrawal Only for Personal Reasons


Insufficient Embryos


Intent for Freeze-All, Unspecific


No Embryos of Desired Sex


Thaw for Refreeze, No Intent to Transfer


Other

columns.name: EMBRYO_NO_TRANSFER_RSN_CMT
columns.description: Comment for the no transfer reason field.

columns.name: ESET_YN
columns.description:
Whether the patient chose to do a single embryo transfer for this cycle.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


No


Yes

columns.name: INSEMINATION_DATE
columns.description: The date of insemination by intrauterine insemination or therapeutic donor insemination.

columns.name: SPERM_COLLECT_METHOD_CMT
columns.description: Comment for the sperm collection methods field.

columns.name: TREATMENT_REASONS_CMT
columns.description: Comment for the reasons for treatment field.

columns.name: PREV_CYCLE_YN
columns.description:
Flags if a cycle was documented retroactively. This should not be used to filter cycles for Society for Assisted Reproductive Technology (SART) reporting. This flag does not necessarily imply the department the cycle was created in is not responsible for the cycle's SART reporting.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: ESET_YN

columns.name: CYCLE_LOC_C_NAME
columns.description:
Location that owns the outcome of the cycle. This location would also be responsible for reporting this cycle to registries.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: CYCLE_LOC_CMT
columns.description: Comment for the cycle location field.

columns.name: TREATMENT_PLAN_PAST_DAYS_NUM
columns.description: Number of days to look prior to the cycle start date to find medications that are relevant to this cycle's treatment.

columns.name: TREATMENT_PLAN_FUTURE_DAYS_NUM
columns.description: Number of days to look into the future to find medications that are relevant to this cycle's treatment.

columns.name: EMBRYO_TRANSFER_NUMBER
columns.description: Stores the number of embryos transferred during a cycle.

columns.name: EMBRYO_TRANSFER_PROC_DATE
columns.description: Stores the date of an embryo transfer for during a cycle.

columns.name: REI_CYCLE_VERSION_C_NAME
columns.description:
This keeps track of what features were available when the cycle was created, which allows cycles created prior to the feature to exclude that feature. For example, cycles that were created before the embryo transfer documentation was introduced should not show that documentation.  This item is only set when the cycle is created, is never updated, and is not directly displayed to end users as it has no clinical significance.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Initial (Before May 21)


Embryo Transfer, Cryopreservation, More Procedures (August 21)


PGT and Assisted Hatching in Lab Procedures

columns.name: EMBRYO_CRYO_NUM
columns.description: The number of embryos cryopreserved for a fertility cycle

columns.name: EGG_CRYO_NUM
columns.description: The number of eggs cryopreserved for a fertility cycle

columns.name: SPERM_CRYO_NUM
columns.description: The number of sperm samples cryopreserved for a fertility cycle.
